intro: Neurolaena lindenii, commonly known as yellow wolfhemp, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and branched. Neurolaena lindenii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands.
